getting-started-angular-v20.title: Getting Started with Angular V20
getting-started-angular-v20.description: Learn how to set up and start developing applications with Angular v20.
getting-started-angular-v20.content:
| Name | Age | Occupation | |-------|-----|------------| | Zhang | 25 | Engineer | | Li | 30 | Designer | | Wang | 28 | Product Manager | 1. AAA 2. BBB 2. CCC - A - B - C Angular [link with a title](https://www.example.com 'This is the link title') v20 **introduces** ~~powerful~~ improvements such as *** signals, the `inject()` function, and better SSR support. This tutorial will guide you through the setup and the first steps. > AAA > > BBb > Install Angular v20, generate a project with ng new , and create your first component. Then explore signals, inject() , and SSR routing as shown in the tutorial. ## 1. Installation First, make sure you have *Node.js 18+* installed. ![Cat](https://media3.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExemxiYmg4NWl1cjNiZDhoeWVkOHJoc3NlbGFxbWtqdHl0Nzdmb2NzeSZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/MDJ9IbxxvDUQM/giphy.gif 'Cat Image') Then install the Angular CLI: ```bash install.sh npm install -g @angular/cli@20 ``` Now create a new project: ```bash ng new my-app --standalone cd my-app ``` ## 2. First Component Angular v20 defaults to standalone components. Let’s create the `AppComponent`: ```typescript app.component.ts import { Component } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', template: '

Hello Angular V20

' }) export class AppComponent {} ``` Run the dev server: ```bash ng serve ``` ## 3. Using Signals Signals provide fine-grained reactivity without RxJS boilerplate. Define a signal and update it: ```typescript counter.ts import { signal } from '@angular/core'; export const counter = signal(0); counter.set(counter() + 1); ``` Use it inside your component template: ```html app.component.html

Value: {{ counter() }}

``` ## 4. Dependency Injection with `inject()` The new `inject()` function replaces constructor injection in many cases: ```typescript my.component.ts import { Component, inject } from '@angular/core'; import { MyService } from './my.service'; @Component({ selector: 'my-comp', template: '{{ service.message }}' }) export class MyComponent { service = inject(MyService); } ``` ## 5. Routing for SSR Angular v20 supports SSR-ready routing. Configure routes in `app.routes.ts`: ```typescript app.routes.ts import { Routes } from '@angular/router'; import { HomeComponent } from './home.component'; export const routes: Routes = [ { path: '', component: HomeComponent }, { path: 'articles/:slug', loadComponent: () => import('./article/article.component').then(m => m.ArticleComponent) } ]; ``` With these steps, you now have a fully working Angular v20 app, complete with signals, modern DI, and SSR-ready routing.
getting-started-angular-v20.solution: Install Angular v20, generate a project with `ng new`, and create your first component. Then explore signals, `inject()`, and SSR routing as shown in the tutorial.

angular-v20-signals.title: Angular V20 Signals Explained
angular-v20-signals.description: Understand Angular v20 signals for reactive state management.
angular-v20-signals.solution: Use `signal()` for reactive state and update values with `.set()`, `.update()`, or `.mutate()`.

dependency-injection-angular-v20.title: Dependency Injection in Angular V20
dependency-injection-angular-v20.description: Learn how to use the new `inject()` function for services in Angular v20.
dependency-injection-angular-v20.solution: Use `inject(Service)` inside components or functions to get an instance of your service.

angular-v20-routing.title: Angular V20 Routing with Guards and Resolvers
angular-v20-routing.description: Configure routes with guards, resolvers, and language prefixes in Angular v20.
angular-v20-routing.content:
Learn to define routes with `canMatch`, `resolve`, and language-aware URL handling.

```ts
{ path: 'articles/:slug', component: ArticleComponent, resolve: { article: ArticleResolver } }
```
angular-v20-routing.solution: Use resolvers for prefetching critical data and guards for dynamic routing rules.

ssr-angular-v20.title: Server-Side Rendering (SSR) in Angular V20
ssr-angular-v20.description: Implement SSR with Angular v20 for SEO-friendly and fast pages.
ssr-angular-v20.content:
Angular v20 continues to support Universal for SSR. You can pre-render pages and fetch data via resolvers for SEO.

```ts
import { provideServerRendering } from '@angular/platform-server';
```
ssr-angular-v20.solution: Use Angular Universal and resolvers to pre-render pages with server-fetched data.

angular-v20-forms.title: Angular V20 Reactive Forms
angular-v20-forms.description: Build reactive forms with signals and validators in Angular v20.
angular-v20-forms.content:
Use `FormGroup` and `FormControl` along with signals for reactive validation.

```ts
const form = new FormGroup({ name: new FormControl('') });
```
angular-v20-forms.solution: Create reactive forms with FormGroup/FormControl and connect them to signals for reactive updates.

angular-v20-httpclient.title: HTTP Requests with Angular V20 HttpClient
angular-v20-httpclient.description: Fetch data from APIs using HttpClient and handle responses in Angular v20.
angular-v20-httpclient.content:
Use HttpClient to perform GET, POST, PATCH, DELETE requests.

```ts
this.http.get<Article[]>('/api/articles').subscribe(data => console.log(data));
```
angular-v20-httpclient.solution: Inject HttpClient and call HTTP methods; use observables or signals for reactive updates.

angular-v20-lazy-loading.title: Lazy Loading Modules in Angular V20
angular-v20-lazy-loading.description: Improve performance with lazy-loaded feature modules in Angular v20.
angular-v20-lazy-loading.content:
Define feature modules and use `loadChildren` in routes for lazy loading.

```ts
{ path: 'admin', loadChildren: () => import('./admin/admin.module').then(m => m.AdminModule) }
```
angular-v20-lazy-loading.solution: Split your app into modules and lazy load features via `loadChildren` for faster initial load.

angular-v20-testing.title: Testing Angular V20 Applications
angular-v20-testing.description: Write unit and integration tests for Angular v20 apps using Jest or Karma.
angular-v20-testing.solution: Use Angular testing utilities to create isolated tests for components and services.

angular-v20-deployment.title: Deploying Angular V20 Apps
angular-v20-deployment.description: Learn how to build, prerender, and deploy Angular v20 applications.
angular-v20-deployment.content:
Use `ng build --prod` and Angular Universal prerendering for SEO-friendly deployment.

```bash
ng run my-app:prerender
```
angular-v20-deployment.solution: Build production bundle and optionally prerender pages before deploying to a server.
